etymologies: early 17th century. From (i) post-classical Latin henoticus serving to unite or unify

definitions: Aiming to unite or reconcile opposing parties or positions; unifying.

notes.text: Originally and chiefly with reference to the emperor Zeno's Henotikon, a decree issued in 482 with the aim of restoring religious unity between the pro-Chalcedonian see of Constantinople and the anti-Chalcedonian see of Alexandria.
